page.title: 02FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: {The farming is mainly mixed}and caters for the surrounding urban areas. At the turn of the century most of the land was in small holdings of approx.20 acres.These small units have now been absorbed into 200-400 acre farms although a few are about 100 acres still. {Grain is the main crop}now e.g.wheat and barley for livestock and some milling wheat for biscuit making. {Sheep farming}is now more in evidence as there is less demand nationally for milk.Dairy herds are only one tenth the size they were 10 years ago. {The main types of machinery}used are:2 &4 wheel drive tractors,chain harrows,heavy rollers,power-driven fertiliser spreaders,hay turners, combined harvesters,ploughs,grain planting machines,crop spreaders,etc.
